questions.question: "Has anyone who has used this fan notice a strong smell coming from it when it is new?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: DDR
answers.text:
Did any of you happen to notice that it has a warning of  Prop 65 WARNING(S) on this Ceiling fan???? It subjects you to Lead Fumes!
It would be my guess that's what the odor is that you're smelling!
It's a shame something like this can even be sold to unaware customers in the US. Just FYI....Who Makes Harbor Breeze Ceiling Fans? Texas-based Litex Industries is an importer and manufacturer of several ceiling fan brands, including Harbor Breeze. Litex has an exclusive relationship with home improvement giant Lowes to distribute, market and sell the brand at is chain of stores. I'd rather spend another extra $100 or more for a ceiling fan for my Son's bedroom and know that he's not also breathing in Lead!

answers.author: NotBuying
answers.text:
Read all of the reviews. This fan should be removed from inventory. From a previous answer by the company, they do not even know that they still sell it.
Foul smells and hot running, oily motors are not good. Sounds like Chinese junk.

answers.author: hotep
answers.text: its a stinker

answers.author: cthehentz
answers.text: yes, I installed two in the same room and the smell lasted about three days.

answers.author: Walter
answers.text: I just put this fan up and it has this horrible smell as well. Today is day 2 and it's coming down.

answers.author: HarborBreeze Team
answers.text: We apologize for the inconvenience and want to help. Please call our customer service department at 1-877-203-9022.

answers.author: buddy
answers.text: I just installed fan. Top mounting bracket went up great tried to put MOTOR on my scews in FAN electrical box was to long had to cut and still had to bend lip on one side of MOTOR bracket to get it slid into place. Yes it has a smell sum times motors made over seas will have a smell. I have heard this over the years. I'm still going to monitor FAN since other people have replaced and still had smell.

answers.author: Kelly
answers.text: I called the manufacturer and they told me that smell is not normal and to return the fan. I replaced it with a brand new one and it had the same issue. We opened the windows and let it run for over a day before the smell came down to a level we could tolerate. Weeks later, the smell is faintly there (but I am sensitive to smells so it may just be me.) Otherwise, this fan works well and is quiet.

answers.author: GDunn
answers.text: Yes, I noticed it as soon I as I opened box, I installed it in conjunction with painting a room and could still smell it over the paint, it's almost a week later now and the smell is almost gone though.

answers.author: jmorgan
answers.text: Ours has a new plastic smell. It's been less than 24 hours since installation so at this point Im still hopeful it will go away on it's own.

questions.question: "This was installed in my building by a tenant that has since moved.  When i turn the wall switch on, the lights come on but the fan doesn't move."
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: HarborBreeze Team
answers.text: The 52-inch Armitage has not been available for more than a couple of years. It always comes with pull chains. I have no idea how your tenant installed the fan, but if the motor doesn't work, I would turn off the power to the fan and check to make sure the wire connections are secure. Especially, the black fan wire. It controls the fan motor. Many times the expansion and contraction of the wires due to turning on and off the light will cause the wires to work apart even with the wire connector on. Remove the wire connector and twist the wires together in a clockwise direction. Then turn the wire connector in a clockwise direction to secure the wires. Tug on the wires to be sure the wire connector is holding both wires in.

answers.author: Martin
answers.text: The fan about which I asked my question did not have pull chains.  It is 10 years old.

answers.author: EB
answers.text: Turn the wall switch on.  The fan should have pull strings.  Pull both the cords separate. One is for the light, other is for fan.  The cord switch was probably off for the fan

answers.author: Kdog
answers.text: Pull the string on the fan for the motor to activate.

questions.question: "Can you put a brighter bulb in it and the bowl still fit? Also, how do you add a remote?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Alueim
answers.text:
As far as the lighting is concerned...
Westinghouse 6.5" Fitter Replacement Glass for Ceiling Fan (found at Lightbulbs.com) will fit the Harbor Breeze Armitage. Also, with this glass you can use the standard LED A19 lightbulb (to get more lumens) instead of the smaller A15 that comes with the Armitage. I know the specs state that the max bulb wattage is 7, but I've been using a 26W CFL (w/o globe) for some time now and I've never had a issue. Now that I have the new Westinghouse globe installed with a 17W LED in it, I'm still not having an issue.

answers.author: HarborBreeze Team
answers.text: Try using a LED bulb if you want higher lumens with low wattage.  Yes, you can install the Harbor Breeze remote control in this fan but you will need to use zip ties to secure the receiver in the canopy so it doesn't interfere with the motor function.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: The maximum bulb wattage recommended for this ceiling fan is 7 watts and is compatible only with A15 shape bulb. You can connect a Harbor universal remote control with this ceiling fan.

questions.question: "Why is the CFM listed as different between the white version (1420) and the other two (2263)? Which is correct? Boxes have same numbers on them."
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: HarborBreeze Team
answers.text:
New government regulations require the CFM to be listed as the average CFM of all speeds. The actual CFM ratings are:
Low speed 1570
Med. speed 3040
High speed 4579

questions.question: "Why won't my light work but fan does"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: HarborBreeze Team
answers.text: Unless the bulbs were damaged in shipping (which does happen), then there is a wiring issue. Please turn off the power to the fan and the light and check the wiring to the light at the outlet box. The blue fan wire is the wire to the light. Many times the expansion and contraction of the wires due to turning on and off the light will cause the wires to work apart even with the wire connector on. With the power off to the fan, remove the wire connector and twist the wires together in a clockwise direction. Then turn the wire connector in a clockwise direction to secure the wires. Tug on the wires to be sure the wire connector is holding both wires in. Also, check the wire connection between the fan and the light kit. Sometimes the wire connectors are pushed together properly, but the wires have been partially pulled out of the connector. If neither of these resolves your issue, don't hesitate to contact customer service (800) 643-0067. They can send you a replacement light kit, if necessary.

questions.question: "The specs say for a small room but the same model fan in different finish says for a large room; is this typo? and does this fan have 3 speeds?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: HarborBreeze Team
answers.text: The fans have High, Medium, and low speed. It sounds like a typo; though there is a 42-inch and 52-inch version of the Armitage. The 52-inch should be adequate for a large room.

questions.question: "What would cause the light to randomly turn itself on in the middle of the night. This have happened twice so far."
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: HarborBreeze Team
answers.text: It sounds like a loose wire or a bad switch. Please turn off the power to the fan and the light and check the wiring to the light at the outlet box. The blue fan wire is the wire to the light. Many times the expansion and contraction of the wires due to turning on and off the light will cause the wires to work apart even with the wire connector on. With the power off to the fan, remove the wire connector and twist the wires together in a clockwise direction. Then turn the wire connector in a clockwise direction to secure the wires. Tug on the wires to be sure the wire connector is holding both wires in. Also, check the wire connection between the fan and the light kit. If neither of these resolves your issue, don't hesitate to contact customer service (800) 643-0067. They can send you a replacement light kit, if necessary.

questions.question: "What exactly does "limited lifetime" warranty mean?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: HarborBreeze Team
answers.text:
This statement is only to clarify. Please read warranty for specifics.
Limited Lifetime means the motor is guaranteed for the purchaser's life (with proof of purchase) unless  there's been damage to the fan caused by something other than normal wear and tear. Other parts besides the motor have a one-year warranty except bulbs and glass.

questions.question: "I wired it in and now it hums.i put 2 up in other rooms and they are quiet.sounds like the gears are making the noise.is there something i can do?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: HarborBreeze Team
answers.text: First, be sure your fan is NOT wired to a wall control. If so, re-wire it to a single-pole on/off wall switch. Also, with fan off, push the blades to make sure something isn't rubbing (ie blade arms to motor housing) due to an assembly error. If you need more specific help, don't hesitate to call customer service (800) 643-0067.  You may be able to email them a video (with sound) to help diagnose the issue. We apologize for the inconvenience; we know your time is valuable.

answers.text: Yes. Be sure the wall control doesn't use a variable-speed (dimmer style) wall control to control the fan motor. Controlling fan speed with a dimmer-style wall control will void the fan's warranty and is a fire hazard. The wall control for the fan should have 3-4 speed settings. If you need more specific help, don't hesitate to call customer service (800) 643-0067.

questions.question: "Why does the light get brighter only when the fan is on? It gets brighter with each change in speed, but is not bright when only the light is on."
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: HarborBreeze Team
answers.text: It sounds like a wiring issue. Please turn off the power to the fan and the light and check the wiring to the light at the outlet box. The blue fan wire is the wire to the light. Many times the expansion and contraction of the wires due to turning on and off the light will cause the wires to work apart even with the wire connector on. With the power off to the fan, remove the wire connectors and twist the wires together in a clockwise direction. Then turn the wire connector in a clockwise direction to secure the wires. Tug on the wires to be sure the wire connector is holding both wires in. Also, check the wire connection between the fan and the light kit. If neither of these resolves your issue, don't hesitate to contact customer service (800) 643-0067. They can send you a replacement light kit, if necessary.

questions.question: "Does this fan make any noise when running? I bought one that has a hum when running."
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: HarborBreeze Team
answers.text: Fans shouldn't make a humming noise. If your fan makes a humming noise, make sure it is not connected to variable speed wall control. Also, double-check your wire connections. Occasionally, cheap bulbs will make a humming noise. Does it hum with the lights off? If you need more specific help, don't hesitate to call customer service (800) 643-0067.

answers.text: The RPM on high speed is 164. The airflow of a fan is not measured by RPMs, rather by CFMs. The CFM rating on high speed is 4579 which should move plenty of air. Please be sure your blades are spinning in a counterclockwise direction for maximum downward airflow. If you need more specific help, don't hesitate to call customer service (800) 643-0067.
